title: How to Sew a Fabric Book Cover

steps.title: Gather your fabric and sewing supplies.
steps.content: Gather your fabric and sewing supplies.

steps.title: Measure the length and width of an open book
steps.content: Measure the length and width of an open book

steps.title: Cut fabric to your desired length and width, allowing for a half-inch seam allowance on all sides.
steps.content: Cut fabric to your desired length and width, allowing for a half-inch seam allowance on all sides. Add an additional two inches in length for "each" pocket, which will be created at both ends of the cover. This should create a long rectangle.

steps.title: Cut an identical piece of iron-on interfacing and iron it onto the wrong side of the fabric.
steps.content: Cut an identical piece of iron-on interfacing and iron it onto the wrong side of the fabric.

steps.title: Turn over the two short sides of the rectangle twice, to form quarter-inch hemlines.
steps.content: Turn over the two short sides of the rectangle twice, to form quarter-inch hemlines. Stitch them in place.

steps.title: With right sides together, fold over two inches at both ends of the rectangle, to create pockets.
steps.content: With right sides together, fold over two inches at both ends of the rectangle, to create pockets. Stitch the upper and lower seams of each pocket.

steps.title: Turn the pockets right side out and iron them flat.
steps.content: Turn the pockets right side out and iron them flat.

steps.title: Between the two pockets, turn over the remaining raw edges twice, to form quarter-inch hemlines.
steps.content: Between the two pockets, turn over the remaining raw edges twice, to form quarter-inch hemlines. Stitch them in place.

steps.title: Slide the front and back cover of your book into the pockets.
steps.content: Slide the front and back cover of your book into the pockets.
